title: Introduction to fMRI Preprocessing
description: A comprehensive guide to preprocessing functional MRI data using popular neuroimaging software packages.

sections.title: Data Organization and Quality Control
sections.content: Proper data organization is crucial for efficient preprocessing. Create a BIDS-compliant directory structure...

codeExamples.code:
# Create BIDS directory structure
mkdir -p bids_dataset/sub-01/func
mkdir -p bids_dataset/sub-01/anat

sections.title: Slice Timing Correction
sections.content: Slice timing correction accounts for the temporal differences in slice acquisition during fMRI scanning...

codeExamples.code:
import nibabel as nib
from nilearn import image

# Load fMRI data
fmri_img = nib.load('sub-01_task-rest_bold.nii.gz')

title: Functional Connectivity Analysis with Python
description: Learn how to perform functional connectivity analysis using Python libraries like Nilearn and Nibabel.

sections.title: Loading and Preparing Data
sections.content: We'll start by loading preprocessed fMRI data and preparing it for connectivity analysis...

codeExamples.code:
import numpy as np
import nibabel as nib
from nilearn import datasets

# Load atlas for region definition
atlas = datasets.fetch_atlas_harvard_oxford('cort-maxprob-thr25-2mm')

sections.title: Correlation Matrix Calculation
sections.content: Calculate functional connectivity using Pearson correlation between time series...

codeExamples.code:
# Calculate correlation matrix
correlation_matrix = np.corrcoef(time_series.T)

# Visualize connectivity matrix
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.imshow(correlation_matrix, cmap='coolwarm')
